intro: Loncomelos magnum, commonly known as the giant lichen, is a unique species belonging to the family Lecanoraceae. It is a saxicolous lichen, typically growing on rocky surfaces in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant exhibits a complex thallus structure composed of fungal and algal components. Its morphology includes a crustose or foliose growth form, often with a dark, leathery appearance. It is notable for its ability to survive in extreme conditions due to its specialized symbiotic relationship between the fungus and algae.
